page.title: 18HORSE RIDING
page.content: Pyecombe Saddlery on the A23 is a thriving local business for local equestrians, open from 9 am to 5.3O each day and 1O am to 3 pm on Sunday. You may purchase anything there from saddles to cotton thread, riding clothes, horse food and bedding. A large riding stables is Brendans at Pyecombe named after the owner's first pony now 38 years old. It has 5O stables with 4O to 5O ponies and horses. Saturday is the busiest day with up to 5O riders. Riding for the Disabled is on Mondays and Thursdays. The stable deals in Irish horses and some are exported. The owner feeds the horses herself as diet is very important. A blacksmith from Lewes visits once a week. The owner also organises 3 British Show Jumping affiliated shows per year. These take 3 months to organise.
